title: Front Brake Pads - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Do not allow a brake component to hang unsupported on the brake hose or line.
Brake hoses or lines that are not supported may become damaged or bent.
Bent or damaged brake hoses or lines lead to reduced braking efficiency causing loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Remove the caliper mounting fixings and slide the brake caliper off the brake disc.
The reflector assembly is attached by the top fixing and will be removed with the fixing.
Remove the circlips from the retaining pins for the brake pads.
The retaining pins have a screw thread into the caliper.
Note the fitted position of the anti-rattle spring and remove the retaining pins and brake pads from the caliper.
Complete the installation of the brake pads to one caliper (see
) before removing the pads from the other caliper.
